component.description: Guidelines for Starlink Software Strategy Groups

abstract.p:
Software Strategy Groups (SSGs) are Starlink user groups which have been set up by the Project to allow it to consult with expert software users and to obtain advice about those software issues which affect the use of its computing service. The SSGs also form an important part of a procedure for annually re-assessing the software priorities of the Project and for identifying future objectives.
This document describes the nature of the SSGs and the role which they play in this procedure. It also covers some administrative arrangements. Its primary purpose is to give guidance to those participating in SSGs, so that they can operate as effectively as possible.
